title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Unemployment rate, with a total of 21 data points.
Overall Unemployment rate has decreased over the Year.

Unemployment rate is roughly constant from 1999 to 2003, slightly decreasing from 2003 to 2006, rapidly increasing from 2006 to 2010, roughly constant from 2010 to 2014, roughly decreasing from 2014 to 2015, and lastly roughly constant from 2015 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.
Max Unemployment rate about 17.81 was recorded at Year 2010
Min Unemployment rate about 4.25 was recorded at Year 2007
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Unemployment rate, with a total of 21 data points. The chart has 3 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2010 to 2019.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2001 to 2007.
But, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2007 to 2010.
